gloss1: very bad
gloss2: infested with lice
example1: That movie was really lousy.
example2: His lousy clothes were full of holes.

gloss1: young of domestic cattle
gloss2: the muscular back part of the shank
example1: The farmer watched the calf play.
example2: He felt a cramp in his calf.

gloss1: utter in an angry, sharp, or abrupt tone
gloss2: record on photographic film
example1: "She snapped at him unexpectedly."
example2: I took a quick snap of the sunset.

gloss1: two-winged insects characterized by active flight
gloss2: an opening in a garment that is closed by a zipper or by buttons concealed under a fold of cloth
example1: The fly landed on the table.
example2: Adjust the fly of your pants.

gloss1: the state of affairs that a plan is intended to achieve and that (when achieved) terminates behavior intended to achieve it
gloss2: a successful attempt at scoring
example1: Achieving your goal is essential for success.
example2: She scored the winning goal yesterday.

gloss1: to compel or force or urge relentlessly or exert coercive pressure on, or motivate strongly
gloss2: operate or control a vehicle
example1: Her ambition drives her to succeed.
example2: I will drive to the store.

gloss1: a flour mixture stiff enough to knead or roll
gloss2: informal terms for money
example1: He rolled out the dough carefully.
example2: I need some dough to buy that.

gloss1: the property of something that is great in magnitude
gloss2: the magnitude of sound (usually in a specified direction)
example1: The volume of water increased rapidly.
example2: Please turn down the volume.

gloss1: a characteristic sound
gloss2: jewelry consisting of a circlet of precious metal (often set with jewels) worn on the finger
example1: Her voice had the ring of truth.
example2: She wore a beautiful gold ring.

gloss1: an actor situated in the audience whose acting is rehearsed but seems spontaneous to the audience
gloss2: (botany) a living organism lacking the power of locomotion
example1: The comedian used a plant in the crowd.
example2: The garden has a beautiful plant.

gloss1: a journey in a vehicle (usually an automobile)
gloss2: hitting a golf ball off of a tee with a driver
example1: Let's take a drive through the countryside.
example2: He hit a long drive down the fairway.

gloss1: the body excluding the head and neck and limbs
gloss2: a collection of particulars considered as a system
example1: She gently stretched her tired body.
example2: The committee reviewed the body of research.

gloss1: a sense of concern with and curiosity about someone or something
gloss2: a fixed charge for borrowing money; usually a percentage of the amount borrowed
example1: She has a keen interest in art.
example2: How much interest do you owe?

gloss1: a flat float (usually made of logs or planks) that can be used for transport or as a platform for swimmers
gloss2: (often followed by 'of') a large number or amount or extent
example1: They built a raft to cross the river.
example2: A raft of ideas flooded the meeting.

gloss1: capable of being changed
gloss2: able to flex; able to bend easily
example1: She has a flexible work schedule.
example2: The flexible branches swayed in the breeze.

gloss1: pleasing to the eye or mind especially through beauty or charm
gloss2: having the properties of a magnet; the ability to draw or pull
example1: She has an attractive smile.
example2: The magnet's attractive force amazed everyone.

gloss1: in an adroit manner
gloss2: in a manner that minimizes dirt and pollution
example1: She cut the paper cleanly in half.
example2: The engine runs cleanly and efficiently.

gloss1: a string of words satisfying the grammatical rules of a language
gloss2: (criminal law) a final judgment of guilty in a criminal case and the punishment that is imposed
example1: She wrote a perfect sentence.
example2: He received a harsh sentence today.

gloss1: the physical condition of being stretched or strained
gloss2: (psychology) a state of mental or emotional strain or suspense
example1: The rope held considerable tension during the pull.
example2: She felt a growing tension inside her.

gloss1: (music) a series of notes differing in pitch according to a specific scheme (usually within an octave)
gloss2: a flattened rigid plate forming part of the body covering of many animals
example1: She practiced the C major scale daily.
example2: The fish had shiny, vibrant scales.

gloss1: be standing; be upright
gloss2: put up with something or somebody unpleasant
example1: Please stand by the door.
example2: I can't stand the noise anymore.

gloss1: be standing; be upright
gloss2: be in some specified state or condition
example1: Please stand by the door.
example2: I stand ready for the challenge.

gloss1: a very attractive or seductive looking woman
gloss2: a blow that renders the opponent unconscious
example1: She was a knockout at the party.
example2: He delivered a powerful knockout punch.

gloss1: an advertisement consisting of short scenes from a motion picture that will appear in the near future
gloss2: a wheeled vehicle that can be pulled by a car or truck and is equipped for occupancy
example1: I watched the new movie trailer online.
example2: They traveled cross-country in their trailer.

gloss1: toward a lower or inferior state
gloss2: toward the bottom of a hill
example1: His health has been going downhill lately.
example2: The bike raced downhill with speed.

gloss1: a flight of stairs or a flight of steps
gloss2: any maneuver made as part of progress toward a goal
example1: She climbed the steps quickly.
example2: Each step brings us closer to success.

gloss1: represent by making a drawing of, as with a pencil, chalk, etc. on a surface
gloss2: elicit responses, such as objections, criticism, applause, etc.
example1: She will draw a beautiful landscape.
example2: Her speech drew enthusiastic applause from the audience.
